title: Ticket #7249: condor_submit fails when args supplied but no submit file
description:
when condor_submit is given arguments sufficient to make a submit, but not a submit file, it fails with the error <code>ERROR: Failed to open command file ((null)) (Invalid argument)<endcode>

when given no arguments, it properly reads from stdin.

These work 

condor_submit -file NUL hold=1 executable=sleep.exe transfer_executable=false -q 1
condor_submit
this does not work 
condor_submit hold=1 executable=sleep.exe transfer_executable=false -q 1
remarks:
2019-Oct-23 12:27:09 by coatsworth:
All looks good. I didn't realize that NUL was the Windows equivalent of /dev/null, but tested it out and works as expected.

I'm marking this as resolved since documentation is already done.
